definition: to be left speechless/unable to respond
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
words/speech/to say/to talk
old variant of 以[yi3]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
old variant of 以[yi3]
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple

sentences.english: This simple question left Rei with nothing to say.
sentences.chinese: 这个简单的问题让丽无言以对。

sentences.english: He was speechless when confronted with the elders' evidence and certificates.
sentences.chinese: 他在老人们出示的房产证面前无言以对。

sentences.english: Neighbors wife almost to tears, speechless.
sentences.chinese: 邻居太太哭笑不得，无言以对。

sentences.english: Visiting his daughter's home, he added the loss left him "speechless".
sentences.chinese: 查看了女儿的寓所，他说痛失女儿令他“无言以对”。

sentences.english: Among the confusion, I am speechless.
And I will never love again, u've left me speechless.
sentences.chinese: 而我再也不能去爱，你让我无言以对。
这个消息使南希无言以对。

sentences.english: I can only kind friend shook his head, speechless.
sentences.chinese: 我只能对好心朋友摇摇头，无言以对。

sentences.english: Ahsoka didn't answer. She stared into mid-distance for a while and chewed her lip.
sentences.chinese: 阿索卡无言以对，她咬着唇，目光移向别处。

sentences.english: I was unable to answer because, frankly, I didn't know.
sentences.chinese: 我无言以对，因为实在不知道怎么回答。

sentences.english: Unable to answer, we walked the rest of the way in silence.
sentences.chinese: 我无言以对，馀下的路我们在沉默中走完了。

sentences.english: I am speechless and I wish they had been.
sentences.chinese: 我无言以对，我想他们已经。

definition: dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to be at a loss for words/speechless
to have nothing to say (idiom)
to remain silent/to have nothing to say/(coll.) speechless/dumbfounded
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
to feel ashamed (idiom)
ashamed and unable to show one's face
unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
faulty argument and poor rhetoric (idiom); unable to put forward any convincing arguments/without a leg to stand on
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
(of speech) indistinct/mumbling/hesitating
reasonable/sensible
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
ashamed
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/both funny and extremely embarrassing/between laughter and tears
lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
